comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Sedan Day is described at en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sedantag It was a holiday in Germany on September 2nd, last celebrated in 1918, celebrating their defeat of France at Sedan in 1870 in the Franco-Prussian war. The significance in 1914, was that Germany was at war again and hoping for another such victory.

comment.author: 93556675@N05
comment._content: That's Unter den Linden, you can see the Zeughaus. The soldiers are from the prussian Gardekorps, but from different regiments: The marching infantrymen are Grenadiers or Fusiliers, the two officers on horse are from artillery (note their helmets).

comment._content: the same spot, about a century later: www.google.com/maps?q=Zeughaus,+Unter+den+Linden,+Berlin,...
